original: HYLANDER, Erik Bergsingenjör, Fagersjö, f Nrkpg 26/1 95 av överlär J H o Fredrika Wallberg, gm Elsa Nordenmark. Studex Nrkpg 13, bergsingex KTH 23. Ass i gruv-vetenskap o gruvmätn KTH 19—20, ass stat djupunders.nmd 20—21, avd.red Bonniers konv.lex 21—29, red i Tekn Tidskr 29—37, red.sekr 35—37, red.medl Nord fam.b 34—39, tekn sekr stat ind.kommiss sed. 39. Traf.stat undersökn h Sthlms gatukont o 31 års trafikkomin 31—34, led Sv stånd.kommiss sed. 42, kyrkoflm Enskede sed. 42, församl.deleg i Sthlm o led lokalstyr Enskede samrealskola sed. 43. Av trycket: Poplär el.tekn (övers 34), Sv Teknol.frn 1861—1936, Biografier I—II (tills m G Indebetou 37), Den förtrollade trädgården (diktsaml 40). Medl S :te or Jens Gille. Hobbies: Personhist studier, poet försök.
translated: HYLANDER, Erik Mining Engineer, Fagersjö, born in Norrköping on January 26th, 1895, son of headmaster J.H. and Fredrika Wallberg, married to Elsa Nordenmark. Graduated from Norrköping High School in 1913, graduated as a mining engineer from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1923. Assistant in Mining Science and Mine Surveying at KTH from 1919-1920, assistant in deep-sea exploration from 1920-1921, editor at Bonniers' Conversation Lexicon from 1921-1929, editor at Teknisk Tidskrift (Technical Journal) from 1929-1937, secretary editor from 1935-1937, editorial board member of Nordisk Familjebok (Nordic Family Encyclopedia) from 1934-1939, technical secretary at the State Industrial Commission since 1939. Traffic inspector at Stockholm Road Office and traffic commissioner for 31 years from 1931-1934, member of the Swedish Steel Commission since 1942, member of the Enskede Church Council since 1942, delegate in the Stockholm parish and member of the Enskede Elementary School Board since 1943. Published works include: "Popular Electrical Engineering" (translated in 1934), "Swedish Technology from 1861-1936", "Biographies I-II" (in collaboration with G. Indebetou in 1937), and "The Enchanted Garden" (a collection of poems in 1940). Member of the Royal Society Jens Gille. Hobbies: Genealogical studies, experimenting with poetry.
